topic.title: HPE Helion Development Platform 2.0: Windows and .NET Applications Tools Guide

body.section:
HPE Helion Development Platform 2.0: Windows and .NET Tools Guide Windows, .NET, SQL Server, and IIS are either registered trademarks or trademarks of Microsoft Corporation in the United States and/or other countries.
Helion Development Platform 1.2 adds tooling support for deploying Windows images and .NET Framework HTTP-based applications. This document describes how to install and use these tools. This document contains the following sections:
.NET tools:
Cloud Foundry Extensions
Cloud Foundry MSBuild Tasks
Cloud Foundry .NET SDK
Setup tools
ALS Cluster Management (cf-mgmt)
Helion client (helion)

section.title: Cloud Foundry Extensions
section.p: This Visual Studio 2013 extension is used to deploy and manage .NET applications. The extension can be used in any edition of VS 2013, including the Community (free) edition.

body.section:
Installation Follow these steps to install the Cloud Foundry Extensions:
Select Tools->Extensions and Updates in Visual Studio 2013.
In the Extensions and Updates panel, search for Cloud Foundry Extentions in the **Online** section.
Install the extension from the search results.
The Cloud Foundry Extensions page on Visual Studio Gallery can be found here.

section.p: For an example of how to deploy an application from Visual Studio, see Deploying your first .NET Application.

section.title: Cloud Foundry MSBuild Tasks
section.p: These MSBuild processes allow you to build and deploy applications to Cloud Foundry instances as part of the usual build process for your application.
The MSBuild Tasks are language and technology agnostic, and can be used to deploy Java, Node, and other applications in addition to .NET applications.
The MSBuild tasks can be installed using NuGet:

ol.li: Right-click the project in Solution Explorer and select Manage NuGet Packages
If a previous version of the Cloud Foundry MSBuild Tasks is already installed, select Installed Packages, and click Uninstall.
Search for Cloud Foundry MSBuild Tasks in the Online section

section.p: The MSBuild Tasks NuGet package can be found here.
For more information on MSBuild, see MSBuild on MSDN .

section.title: Cloud Foundry .NET SDK
section.p: The SDK is used for programmatic access to controlling Windows images and .NET applications. Using the SDK, developers can create build and deployment automation and tools that interact with the ALS APIs.
The Cloud Foundry .NET SDK can be installed using NuGet:

ul.li: Right-click the project in Solution Explorer and select Manage NuGet Packages.

section.p: The CloudFoundry NuGet package can be found here.

section.title: Helion Client
section.p: This tool is used to deploy applications from the command line. The same tool is used for deploying applications to Windows and Linux instances.
section.note: .NET applications are built on the server using MSBuild. You should verify that your application builds with MSBuild before deploying.
section.p: To deploy a .NET application to a Windows instance, use the following syntax from the same folder as your manifest.yml file:
section.codeblock: helion target <cluster URL> helion login helion push --stack win2012r2
